lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

* Represents an archive of tasks in the Duke application.
* This class provides methods to manage and manipulate tasks.
* Constructs a new TaskList object with the specified list of tasks.
* @param list The initial list of tasks to be managed.
* Prints the list of tasks in the archive along with their indices.
* Marks a task as completed based on user input.
* @param input The input string containing the task index to mark.

return "I HAVE MARKED THIS TASK:" + curr;
* Marks a completed task as incomplete based on user input.
* @param input The input string containing the task index to unmark.
* @throws OutOfIndexException If the provided index is out of the valid range.
return "I HAVE UNMARKED THIS TASK:" + curr;
* Deletes a task based on user input.

* @throws OutOfIndexException If the provided index is out of the valid range.
return "I HAVE DELETED THE FOLLOWING TASK:" + curr + "\nNOW YOU HAVE "
* Adds a task to the archive based on user input.
* @param input The input string containing the task details.
* @throws EmptyDeadlineException If the deadline task is missing required details.
* @throws EmptyTodoException     If the todo task is missing a title.
* @throws EmptyEventException    If the event task is missing required details.
* @throws MissingByException     If the deadline task is missing the "by" date.
* @throws MissingFromException   If the event task is missing the start date.
* @throws MissingToException     If the event task is missing the end date.
* @throws MissingTitleException  If a task is missing its title.
* @throws InvalidInputException  If the input doesn't match any valid task format.
public String addTask(String[] input) throws InvalidInputException, InvalidDateFormatException {
added = new Event(input[0], parseDate(input[1]), parseDate(input[2]), false);
return ("I'VE ADDED THIS TASK: " + added + "\nYOU HAVE " + list.size() + " TASKS IN THE LIST");

* @throws InvalidDateFormatException If the input string has an invalid date-time format.
public LocalDateTime parseDate(String input) throws InvalidDateFormatException {

* The UI class handles user interactions and printing messages in the Duke application.
* Prints the introduction message with the Duke logo.
* Reads a line of input from the user.
* @return The user input as a string.
* Custom exception class for Duke application.
* This exception is used to handle errors specific to the Duke application.
* Constructs a new DukeException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message associated with the exception.
* Returns the error message associated with this exception.
* Custom exception class for empty deadline entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to add a deadline task without a title or due date.
* Constructs a new EmptyDeadlineException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the correct format for adding a deadline.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! Missing entry. ENTER deadline (title) /by (dueDate) to"
* Custom exception class for empty event entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to add an event task without a title, start date, or end date.
* Constructs a new EmptyEventException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the correct format for adding an event.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! Missing entry. ENTER event (title) /from (from) /to (to) to"
* Custom exception class for empty todo entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to add a todo task without a title.
* Constructs a new EmptyTodoException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the correct format for adding a todo.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! Missing title of todo. ENTER todo (title) to add a todo");
* The InvalidDateFormatException class represents an exception that is
* thrown when an invalid date format is encountered in Duke's task input. This exception
* is typically thrown when dates for 'by', 'from', or 'to' fields are not in the
* Constructs an InvalidDateFormatException with a default error message.
* The default error message informs the user about the expected date format.
super("Invalid date format! Input dates for 'by', 'from', or 'to' should use the following format:"
* The InvalidFindException class represents an exception that is
* thrown when an invalid "find" command is encountered in Duke's input. This exception
* is typically thrown when the "find" command does not include a valid keyword or key phrase.
* The correct format for the "find" command is "find (keyword / key phrases)".
* Constructs an InvalidFindException with a default error message.
* The default error message instructs the user on the correct usage of the "find" command.
super("Invalid find command. Enter 'find (keyword / key phrases)'");
* Custom exception class for invalid input entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user provides an input that doesn't match any valid command formats.
* Constructs a new InvalidInputException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the correct format to start various types of tasks.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! START WITH todo (title) or "
* Custom exception class for missing "by" date entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to add a deadline task without specifying the "by" date.
* Constructs a new MissingByException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the correct format for adding a deadline.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! Missing by. ENTER deadline (title) /by (dueDate) to add a deadline");
* Custom exception class for missing "from" date entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to add an event task without specifying the start date.
* Constructs a new MissingFromException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the correct format for adding an event.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! Missing event start date. ENTER event (title) /from (from)"
* Custom exception class for missing title entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to add a task without providing a title.
* Constructs a new MissingTitleException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the importance of providing a title for tasks.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! MISSING TITLE!");
* Custom exception class for missing "to" date entries in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to add an event task without specifying the end date.
* Constructs a new MissingToException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the correct format for adding an event.
super("I DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU'VE GOT! Missing event end date. ENTER event (title) /from (from) /to"
* Custom exception class for out-of-index task access in the Duke application.
* This exception is thrown when a user attempts to access a task using an index that is out of the valid range.
* Constructs a new OutOfIndexException with a predefined error message.
* The error message informs the user about the fact that they provided an invalid task index.
super("You have provided a number out of index of the stored tasks");

* Represents a task with a deadline in the Duke application.

* @param dueDate  The due date of the deadline.
* @param isMarked The marking status of the deadline.

* Retrieves the due date of the deadline.
* @return The due date of the deadline.
* Represents an event task in the Duke application.

* @param from     The start date of the event.
* @param to       The end date of the event.
* @param isMarked The marking status of the event.
public Event(String title, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to, boolean isMarked) {

* Verifies that an exception is thrown.

* Test marking a task with a non-integer input index.
* Verifies that the task's marked status is not changed.

* Verifies that the task's marked status is changed to true.
assertEquals("You have provided a number out of index of the stored tasks", e.getMessage());
* Test marking an already marked task.
